docs.lead_paragraph: A majority of Americans say Congress should make sure Obamacare subsidies to buy health insurance are available nationwide if the Supreme Court rules that the payments in at least 34 states are illegal, according to a poll released on Tuesday.

headline.main: Most Americans Want Congress to Ensure Obamacare Subsidies: Poll
headline.print_headline: Most Americans Want Congress to Ensure Obamacare Subsidies: Poll

docs.snippet: A majority of Americans say Congress should make sure Obamacare subsidies to buy health insurance are available nationwide if the Supreme Court rules that the payments in at least 34 states are illegal, according to a poll released on Tuesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: The psychiatrist who treated James Holmes before he attacked a Colorado movie theater said Tuesday that she would have called police and had him detained if she had known his plans.

headline.main: Psychiatrist: Colorado Shooter Never Revealed Murderous Plan
headline.print_headline: Psychiatrist: Colorado Shooter Never Revealed Murderous Plan

docs.snippet: The psychiatrist who treated James Holmes before he attacked a Colorado movie theater said Tuesday that she would have called police and had him detained if she had known his plans.

docs.lead_paragraph: Two recent reports provide evidence of the hard-to-justify high prices that many hospitals charge for common procedures.
docs.abstract: Editorial points to study published in journal Health Affairs and report released by Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services that both show how the high list prices that many hospitals charge for common medical procedures drive up health insurance premiums and costs for uninsured; suggests federal legislation to limit hospital prices would address high cost of care in way that market forces cannot.
docs.snippet: Two recent reports provide evidence of the hard-to-justify high prices that many hospitals charge for common procedures.

keywords.value: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: An emerging campaign theme is a way not only to appeal to the middle class but also to convey that when it comes to political combat, Hillary Rodham Clinton is not President Obama..

headline.main: Hillary Clinton’s Vows to ‘Fight’ Evoke a Populist Appeal and a Contrast With Obama
headline.print_headline: Clinton’s Vows to ‘Fight’ Evoke a Populist Appeal and a Contrast With Obama

docs.abstract: Emerging theme of Hillary Rodham Clinton's presidential campaign is that she is a fighter; tactic aligns her with middle class values but also sets her apart from Pres Obama, perceived by many to have a leadership style lacking in forcefulness.
docs.snippet: An emerging campaign theme is a way not only to appeal to the middle class but also to convey that when it comes to political combat, Hillary Rodham Clinton is not President Obama..

byline.original: By AMY CHOZICK and PATRICK HEALY

docs.lead_paragraph: Talks, hearings and earlier opinions are scoured for hints about how the Supreme Court will rule this month on same-sex marriage and the health care law.

headline.main: Justices’ Words Are Combed for Clues as Major Decisions Loom at Court
headline.print_headline: Justices’ Words Are Combed for Clues as Major Decisions Loom at Court

docs.abstract: Adam Liptak Sidebar column notes that the public and the media are scouring previous remarks, from hearings to earlier opinions, in search for clues about how the Supreme Court will rule in cases considering same-sex marriage and a constitutional challenge to Pres Obama's health care reform law.
docs.snippet: Talks, hearings and earlier opinions are scoured for hints about how the Supreme Court will rule this month on same-sex marriage and the health care law.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration gave conditional approval Monday to Arkansas, Delaware and Pennsylvania to expand their roles in the insurance marketplaces created under the 2010 health care law, ahead of a high court decision that could wipe out federal health insurance subsidies for millions.

headline.main: 3 States Get Feds' OK for Health Insurance Marketplaces
headline.print_headline: 3 States Get Feds' OK for Health Insurance Marketplaces

docs.lead_paragraph: A hospital group in cash-strapped Illinois says the state might be able to set up a health insurance exchange at a lower cost by "leasing" the federal government's technology, an option that could appeal to as many as 34 states where subsides could be jeopardized by an unfavorable U.S. Supreme Court decision.

headline.main: Hospital Group Says Illinois Could Lease Healthcare.gov

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge handed a partial victory to the former CEO of American International Group, who claimed the government's bailout of the insurance giant in the heat of the financial crisis was unfairly punitive.

headline.main: US Judge Gives Partial Victory to Ex-AIG CEO in Bailout Case
headline.print_headline: US Judge Gives Partial Victory to Ex-AIG CEO in Bailout Case

docs.snippet: A federal judge handed a partial victory to the former CEO of American International Group, who claimed the government's bailout of the insurance giant in the heat of the financial crisis was unfairly punitive.
